name: Schema Tester 3000
description: Internal tool for safely testing and deploying target schemas. Simplifies TS validation, comparison, customer mapping export, hypothetical channel exports, and deployment. Used by PAO and Connections teams to process 400+ TSR requests monthly. Supports GUI, API, and Jira-triggered testing workflows.

name: Schema Tester 3000
description: Abbreviation for Schema Tester 3000, the internal tool used for safely testing and deploying target schemas.

name: Target Schema
description: In the context of Schema Tester 3000 and Salsify Connections, TS refers to Target Schema - a way to encode retailer requirements that determines what attributes are allowed/required for publishing to a channel.

name: Target Schema Request
description: A Jira ticket type used by the PAO team to track target schema update requests. TSR tickets can trigger automated testing in Schema Tester 3000 when transitioned to Testing status.

name: Partner Automation Operations
description: Team responsible for managing Packaged Template target schemas at Salsify. Handles over 400 target schema requests per month and uses Schema Tester 3000 for testing workflows triggered via Jira TSR tickets.

name: Packaged Template
description: A type of target schema managed by the PAO team. Packaged Template target schemas require special handling and testing procedures in Schema Tester 3000, including Jira integration and GitHub repository management in the salsify-ts organization.

name: Salsify Target Schema Organization
description: GitHub organization containing target schema repositories. Schema Tester 3000 requires read/write access to repos in this org for Packaged Template target schema testing.

name: Connections Packaged Template Service
description: A service that Schema Tester 3000 integrates with for Packaged Template target schema testing. Requires service-security authentication with a valid SUPERUSER_TOKEN.
